item.title: Clean Desk
item.author: michael@datachain.consulting (Michael John Peña)
item.description: Having a clean desk is something I aspire to every now and then. I’ve been trying to find different ways to have an optimise working environment for my creative and logical output (programming and presenting).

item.title: Using WSL2 (Windows Subsystem for Linux) for Blockchain Development
item.author: michael@datachain.consulting (Michael John Peña)
item.description: In the past, I’ve been using my Macbook Pro to do all things blockchain and smart contracts development. One of the hurdles I encountered in the past is that some tooling and frameworks were not first class citizens on Windows.

item.title: Watching Movies
item.author: michael@datachain.consulting (Michael John Peña)
item.description: Watching movies is my hobby. It’s been like that since I was young. I think it all began when I was so fascinated with advanced graphic designs of things.

item.title: Losing Weight
item.author: michael@datachain.consulting (Michael John Peña)
item.description: Losing weight is actually very simple. You’ll literally just have to eat less. It’s that simple. Then, of course, losing weight does not really equate to being healthy.

item.title: Event Planning
item.author: michael@datachain.consulting (Michael John Peña)
item.description: Planning an event is both fun and frustrating at the same time. It’s fun because you get to do something that is servicing for others (such as a community or group of people).

item.title: Friendship
item.author: michael@datachain.consulting (Michael John Peña)
item.description: There are so many things you can talk about, friendship. I would like to focus on the benefits and the positive side of it, rather than the downside.

item.title: NFTs
item.author: michael@datachain.consulting (Michael John Peña)
item.description: Non-Fungible Tokens or also known as NFTs are a big hype right now. It’s been around for quite some time now, but we’re just seeing more use cases and platforms emerging as part of this trend.

item.title: What are these blockchain and crypto tokens?
item.author: michael@datachain.consulting (Michael John Peña)
item.description: So you keep hearing or reading about “tokens”, these “cryptos”, the “blockchain bitcoins”, and so on. It’s been quite some time now that it has involved me with blockchains and cryptos that over and over, I have to explain to people (often new clients) on what are these tokens.

item.title: Sydney
item.author: michael@datachain.consulting (Michael John Peña)
item.description: Sydney is home for me. When I first came here on 2011, I already knew that this place is home and this is where I want to grow a family.

item.title: Mental Block
item.author: michael@datachain.consulting (Michael John Peña)
item.description: Sometimes we experience a state of “mental block”. It’s when we can’t think creatively or logically to solve a specific problem.

item.title: Trust
item.author: michael@datachain.consulting (Michael John Peña)
item.description: Trust is a currency that is both common and unique to humanity. Before currencies came to life, we use trust as the means of transaction.

item.title: Midnight Oil
item.author: michael@datachain.consulting (Michael John Peña)
item.description: There are some legitimate excuse in my opinion to burn the midnight oil - aka work late at night. I do this so that I don’t have to work over the weekends, and I can spend a lot of quality time with my family.

item.title: Season
item.author: michael@datachain.consulting (Michael John Peña)
item.description: Winter, spring, summer, or fall - I love bits and pieces of them. I love that on winter I can have a cool environment to sleep on.

item.title: Community
item.author: michael@datachain.consulting (Michael John Peña)
item.description: Community is a place where you find people with similar interests or profession. I’ve been involved with the tech community for a decade now, and I still love meeting new people and talk about ideas, problems, and solutions about tech!

item.title: Practice
item.author: michael@datachain.consulting (Michael John Peña)
item.description: Practice makes perfect. Maybe not “perfect” for everyone, but close to the objective or your goal. It takes a lot of repetition to truly master a craft or a profession, you need to spend a lot of those hours in order to learn what works and what doesn’t work.

item.title: Building a House
item.author: michael@datachain.consulting (Michael John Peña)
item.description: Building a house is not easy. There are so many things involved and it can get complicated and complex really quick.

item.title: Weekends
item.author: michael@datachain.consulting (Michael John Peña)
item.description: Weekends are very important to me now. Back then, I treat it as a way to do more work while others are busy with their personal lives.

item.title: Startup
item.author: michael@datachain.consulting (Michael John Peña)
item.description: Joining or starting a start-up is not as simple as it could be. There are a lot of complexity involved. From finding and partnering with the right set of people, to creating and building the actual product.

item.title: Markdown
item.author: michael@datachain.consulting (Michael John Peña)
item.description: I’m particularly liking the Markdown format in creating notes. Thanks to [[RoamResearch]] and [[Hugo]] (with the whole JAMstack craze), I am being sucked in this cult.

item.title: Podcasts
item.author: michael@datachain.consulting (Michael John Peña)
item.description: It’s fun recording podcasts episode as this is a way for me to learn (or refresh) on topics with a different perspective.

item.title: Overwhelmed
item.author: michael@datachain.consulting (Michael John Peña)
item.description: Overwhelmed. I think that’s a state when you have a lot of things in your mind and you’re fighting an internal battle on how to deal with your problems.

item.title: Motivation
item.author: michael@datachain.consulting (Michael John Peña)
item.description: Motivation is something that everyone needs in order to thrive in their day. Having motivation is like taking a bath: not because you had it yesterday, you’ll be okay for today and tomorrow.

item.title: Running
item.author: michael@datachain.consulting (Michael John Peña)
item.description: Running is an activity that I particularly like. It doesn’t have a lot of rules, and it’s a sport or game that is natural to all of us humans.

item.title: Productive Day
item.author: michael@datachain.consulting (Michael John Peña)
item.description: A productive day at work means I get to finish tasks that I committed on time. This rarely happens because either the estimates are wrong, or there are just so many things that happens unexpectedly.

item.title: Listen
item.author: michael@datachain.consulting (Michael John Peña)
item.description: Learn to shut up. It’s easier said than done. Especially if you grew up to speak what’s on your mind. However, we weren’t taught how to listen - like properly listen to a person, surrounding, a video, and even thoughts.

item.title: Perfect
item.author: michael@datachain.consulting (Michael John Peña)
item.description: There is no such thing as perfect. You’ll just have to chase what’s going to be perfect for you. You will feel constant disappointment time and time again.

item.title: Sleep
item.author: michael@datachain.consulting (Michael John Peña)
item.description: Focus is very important. This is what sets a task to be done in months or days into hours and minutes.

item.title: Sleep
item.author: michael@datachain.consulting (Michael John Peña)
item.description: Sleep is very important for the obvious health reasons. What I also found out is that having a good sleep allows me to be a creative thinker when I have to think of new ideas.

item.title: Message to the young
item.author: michael@datachain.consulting (Michael John Peña)
item.description: I recently gave a graduation speech to my high school alma matter. Compared to my usual technical talks, this time it’s about inspiring the younger generation and to share some of the key lessons and experiences I’ve had for over 12 years since I graduated.

item.title: Deadlines
item.author: michael@datachain.consulting (Michael John Peña)
item.description: Sometimes I don’t believe that there is such thing as a “deadline” or end of life for a project. You just define what you want to build given the time, resources, and talent that is available for you.

item.title: Binaural Beats
item.author: michael@datachain.consulting (Michael John Peña)
item.description: [[Binaural Beats]] is a type of music that really works for me. It helps me stay relaxed, calm, and focused. This is my go to playlist when I need to work at night.

item.title: Achieving Success
item.author: michael@datachain.consulting (Michael John Peña)
item.description: Achieving “success” is actually very simple, but the process is often hard. For example, you want to be an author, all you have to do is to keep on writing - over and over, day in and out.

item.title: What is success?
item.author: michael@datachain.consulting (Michael John Peña)
item.description: What is success? Spoiler alert: It’s relative. What it means is that success would mean differently to each and every individual.

item.title: Online Influencers
item.author: michael@datachain.consulting (Michael John Peña)
item.description: Be careful with influencers. Most of the time, they are after their own agenda. You’re just a number in their likes, views, and subscribers.

item.title: Keep on Writing
item.author: michael@datachain.consulting (Michael John Peña)
item.description: I have to keep on writing. Write what I feel. Write what I know. Start it, even if it’s just a draft.
